com.punchthrough.bean.sdk.internal.utility

Class Convert

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.punchthrough.bean.sdk.internal.utility.Convert

  • public class Convert
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities to help cast data from one type to another. Useful for working with types Java doesn't support such as unsigned bytes.

      • bytesToHexString

        public static java.lang.String bytesToHexString(byte[] bytes)

      • asciiHexToBytes

        public static byte[] asciiHexToBytes(java.lang.String hex)
                              throws DecoderException
        Convert a string of ASCII hex characters (e.g. "DEADBEEF0042") to an array of bytes the hex represents (e.g. [0xDE, 0xAD, 0xBE, 0xEF, 0x00, 0x42]). Treat bytes returned by this method as unsigned.
        Parameters:
        hex - The string of hex characters
        Returns:
        An array of bytes the string represents
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.codec.DecoderException - If the string passed in isn't made up of valid hex bytes
        DecoderException

      • bytesToInt

        public static int bytesToInt(byte high,
                             byte low)
        Convert two unsigned bytes to one signed int. Based on this StackOverflow ansewr.
        Parameters:
        high - The high byte
        low - The low byte
        Returns:
        The high byte combined with the low byte as an unsigned int

      • twoBytesToInt

        public static int twoBytesToInt(byte[] bytes,
                                java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Convert an array of two unsigned bytes with the given byte order to one signed int.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to be parsed
        order - The byte order to be used
        Returns:
        An int representing the bytes in the given order

      • intToTwoBytes

        public static byte[] intToTwoBytes(int i,
                                   java.nio.ByteOrder order)

      • intToByte

        public static byte intToByte(int i)
        Convert an int to an unsigned byte.
        Parameters:
        i - The int to be converted
        Returns:
        The int in unsigned byte form

      • intArrayToByteArray

        public static byte[] intArrayToByteArray(int[] intArray)
        Convert an array of ints to an array of unsigned bytes. This is useful when you want to construct a literal array of unsigned bytes with values greater than 127. Only the lowest 8 bits of the int values are used.
        Parameters:
        intArray - The array of ints to be converted
        Returns:
        The corresponding array of unsigned bytes

      • intToUInt32

        public static byte[] intToUInt32(int i,
                                 java.nio.ByteOrder endian)
        Convert an int to a four-byte array of its representation as an unsigned byte.
        Parameters:
        i - The int to be converted
        endian - The ByteOrder endianness of the desired byte array
        Returns:
        The array of bytes representing the 32-bit unsigned integer
